meanings.definition: A person who shares in the ownership or possession of something with another.
meanings.sent1: My friend is my colessor of the new bike we bought together.
meanings.sent2: The colessor of the house is responsible for paying half of the mortgage.
meanings.sent3: As colessors of the secret recipe, we must guard it with our lives.
meanings.sent4: Being colessors of the treasure map, we set out on an adventure together.
meanings.sent5: The colessor of the rare painting was thrilled to display it in their home.

meanings.definition: To jointly own or possess something with another person.
meanings.sent1: We colessor the car, taking turns driving to work.
meanings.sent2: They decided to colessor the business and share the profits equally.
meanings.sent3: Let's colessor this project and work together to make it successful.
meanings.sent4: The siblings colessor the family farm, continuing the tradition.
meanings.sent5: The couple chose to colessor the vacation home by the beach.
